properties.areaDesc: Peoria; Marshall; Fulton; Stark; Schuyler; Knox
properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 9 at 2:17PM CST until January 12 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Lincoln IL
properties.description:
...Significant Ice and Snow Accumulations Possible Overnight
Friday Night through Saturday Evening West of the IL River...

* WHAT...Rain will change to a mixture of freezing rain and sleet
during overnight Friday night and Saturday morning, with snow
also possible by Saturday morning. The wintry mix with change to
a period of moderate to heavy snow late Saturday afternoon and
Saturday evening. Total ice and sleet accumulations near a
quarter inch is possible overnight Friday night into Saturday.
Total snow accumulations of 3 to 7 inches are also possible
Saturday afternoon and Saturday evening, with the heavier
amounts expected over Knox and Stark counties. Winds could gust
as high 35 to 40 mph could cause some blowing and drifting snow
Saturday evening.

* WHERE...Portions of central and west central Illinois, west of
the Illinois river.

* WHEN...From overnight Friday night through Saturday evening.

* IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are possible due to the
ice and windy conditions. Travel could be significantly impacted
across the area overnight Friday night through Saturday
evening.
properties.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING
